#summary Introduction to running znc on Windows
#labels Featured,Phase-Deploy

===System Requirements===

  * Microsoft Windows 2000 with IE6 or newer (XP, 2003, Vista, 2008, 7)
  * IPv6 support in ZNC is not available before [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms742214%28VS.85%29.aspx Windows XP SP1]!
  * *Starting with version 0.098:* Microsoft Visual C++ 2010 SP1 Redistributable Package ([http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=c32f406a-f8fc-4164-b6eb-5328b8578f03 32 Bit] / [http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=C68CCBB6-75EF-4C9D-A326-879EAB4FCDF8 64 Bit])
  * *Earlier versions:* Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 SP1 Redistributable Package ([http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=A5C84275-3B97-4AB7-A40D-3802B2AF5FC2&displaylang=en 32 Bit] / [http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=BA9257CA-337F-4B40-8C14-157CFDFFEE4E&displaylang=en 64 Bit])
  * Windows 2000 also needs KB835732
  * Network connection

===First Start===
Open a new cmd.exe instance, navigate to the folder where znc.exe resides, type `znc --makeconf`, then follow the instructions. When you're done, simply enter `znc` and hit return to start the program.

===Notes===
  * Details about using modules, webadmin and so on can be found on the [http://en.znc.in/wiki/ZNC official ZNC website].
  * You currently have to keep the console window open. Closing it will shut down ZNC. A proper GUI to send ZNC to the system tray is in the works.
  * To run ZNC as a service, read ServiceSetup or use [http://www.google.com/search?q=SrvAny SrvAny].
